intro: Eremogone kingii var. plateauensis, commonly known as the plateau eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Eremogone kingii var. plateauensis is well adapted to sandy soils and can survive with minimal water, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
